Story #6 Part-1

  • March 23, 2021
  • Zizi

For the most part my creature kept others away. But visitors still came sometimes. There were nights when I woke up in the middle state between dreaming and being awake, and saw faces in the wall, staring at me. Once I woke up with a heavy feeling in my chest. I lifted a blanket and a face was looking at me, lying on my body. Another time, there was a wild animal screaming in the corridor. It was a pretty intense and scary time.

My psychiatrist friend turned into my boyfriend, and it was my first long term relationship. I cared about his feelings and trusted him a lot. He stopped me twice from committing suicide. First time I was around 18. It was an evening of early spring. Snow was still outside, but rivers already opened up. I made my mind to jump into a river from a bridge on the other end of the city. I got dressed, took my stuffed bear and left the room. Kirill caught me at the corner of my apartment building. He felt something wrong and came just on time. I tried hard to get rid of him, but he did not let me go. Finally, I told him that I’m done, and I’m going to stop this misery. He said that he is going with me. I could not objectively say how serious I was, but the idea of coursing someone’s death was unacceptable for me. So we went home. And he stayed by my side for two years. He left me, when I was in a 2-week visit to Germany from the University. I was shocked from such news. And met him at a club after sometime. We talked, and he said that everything nice and warm that he had for me is dead now and nothing left. It was unbearable for me. He was my tiny little stick I could hold on to have any sense to live. The one and only support was gone. Life turned to a totally dark, cold, lonely place again. The mind created the second decision to stop this misery. I said goodbye to Kirill, ordered a taxi and stood at the door of a club having a cigarette. I saw a knife and my kitchen, opened door of the flat. It was raining. Kirill felt me again. The taxi was not coming, so he caught me at the door and pulled me back to the club. We talked till the morning and that helped me. The mind changed. We were in a short contact for three years as he owed me money. We were renting a flat for a super low price, and he was supposed to collect that money, and he did not. So when one day I got a call to send the money to the landlord I called Kirill. I asked for the money, and he said he had none. That was a great time to learn who my real friends were. At that moment I had to send 24000 rubbles, which is around 320 USD. I was earning 8000 rubbles, which is $108, for my month living and my mom sent me 5000 = $67 to pay for the flat. As you see it was insane to get this money at once. I had 3 days to find them. People who I thought were my friends told me to call my mother. I have never asked her for help or money. At that moment I was studying at psychological faculty in the evenings, so my classmates were adults who worked. So I asked 2 people from a group and my friend’s lover. These 3 people borrowed me money. I was paying that debt for a year and a bit. It was hard to pull even a thousand from my tiny salary. Those people helped me because they trusted me as a responsible individual. That touched me a lot. Those people did not really know me, but they trusted and helped.

I did not want to ask my mother for money because I rarely asked her for anything. I can remember few moments when I did ask for something.

When I turned 13 my body changed a lot. I got big boobs pretty fast and gained weight. There was no explanation about what is going on with my body. I got ashamed of boobs and had no bras to cover myself and most of my clothes got small. I borrowed some sweaters from my mother’s wardrobe, and learned about bras from my friend. That year my friends/boys turned into hungry wolves, staring at my boobs and wide hips. It felt like my own body betrayed me. Everything was so thin and comfortable before and then suddenly turned into strange huge everything. That winter I was wearing my mother’s old-fashioned boots. They were so ugly and did not match anything that everyday I felt totally ashamed and confused. I did not say anything. I was just going through that misery every day. One evening my elder brother came to mom’s house. He was already living on his own and working. But he came in nice jeans and jacket and asked mom to give him money for a new pair of pans. And mother just pulled it from the wallet and gave. I was so jealous that I started crying like crazy and yelling that she buys so easily anything he wants, and I have to go through this shame everyday wearing her clothes and shoes. After that we went to some shops and bought me some clothes, bras and boots.

During the university period I never asked my mother for money. She sent a certain amount every month and this was it. I was doing my best to survive and spend it carefully. But quite often at the end of the month I had to walk home after the university. Because there was not enough money for a street car. So I used the leftover money for a morning ride cause the walk took 2 hours or so. I had some cheap pastries for breakfast, ate something at the university and had dinner at my aunt’s place. That dinner was always a saviour, because sometimes I was out of money for food in the university, so I skipped the lunch. It was hard to figure out how to spend the money properly. I was having fun for the first part of the month and then could hardly make it to the end of the month.

After I started my psychological education studying at the languages faculty turned easier. I started to ask questions when the teachers tried to give me a satisfactory mark. The faculty of translation means that you deal with the dictionaries a lot, and you chose certain words among a line of others with the same meaning. So when a teacher checked and judged the quality of my translation I asked questions: “Why my translation is worse than someone who gets a better mark? Why their choice of words is better and more correct?” That was as funny as sad. None of the teacher could explain, so their answer became: “will you be satisfied with a good mark?” I answered “yes”. Done. After some time they just started to give me good marks.

For 5 years of translation faculty I met 4 nice teaches. One was an interesting old man. He liked me and we had nice discussions sometimes. His subject was about culture. He organized the exam the way that only one person entered the room. When I entered it he asked: “so what’s your plans for this winter holidays?”. I was going to visit my mother on the island. So he replied: “Nice! I will not hold you then. Take a good rest!” And gave me an offset. That felt so cool. He was on my side. The second teacher was a super strict tiny lady. She taught us the German language. She did not like me at first, because I shaved my head at that time and that was quite unusual. So, she asked me to wear a hat at her classes. I did so and I won her heart with my strong knowledge of German language which I got from my brilliant teacher at school. She gave me an excellent mark at the final exam even when I made a mistake. The third was a nice teacher of Latin language. We built a team to participate in the university humorous competition. We were going to play for our faculty. And she was responsible for this type of activity, so the deal was: if we take first or second place, we all get offset. We got second place. We could not get the first because the lawyer faculty was drinking with the judges. And the last one was a petite sweet lady for French classes. It was free, so I thought I can take it. But after a few tries I realized I did not really have time for that. So I gave up.

I was attending all the classes and very often made the class go crazy. The translation is a very funny thing. For example on simultaneous translation class you have to say something even if you understood nothing from a dictated sentence, so those who did not understand were boggling around all the time. And I was laughing really loud all the time and this made everyone laugh. The teaches asked me to leave the room to stop this laughter, but I continued in the corridor and after a while came back. I was making fun of the teachers all the time as well. Especially when the whole group was coping the works from the excellent students one from another. I set right near the excellent one and then every single person copied. There were moments when teaches screamed: “I know you are copying, but I can not catch you!” They could not even imagine that we actually can help each other and work as a team. That was so much fun.

The psychological faculty also was not rich with nice teaches, but the material was so interesting for me that it did not matter. I passed almost all exams for excellent marks. There was one good mark given by the lady whom I answered two tickets with questions and extra question. But as she said: “This answer is not an excellent one. And I know about you promise for your mom to get a red degree (which allows two good marks in it only). So I give you a good mark”. And her face was full of pride and a smile, full of pleasure of putting me down. It was shocking for me because this is a teacher of psychology, who might consult people as well. My morality was so strong, so such teachers were not considered as good examples.

I mentioned before a teacher of changed states of mind subject. He was the one who told me about LSD, magic mushrooms and holotropic breathing. I was sitting in the classroom and thought I should try this breathing or find LSD. At those times I wanted to remember past lives so much. And I got luck. A good master of holotropic breathing was coming to the city and my friend was organizing this group. So I got a discount and took part. I liked the master at once. He was a tall man with long white hair and beard, big round tummy and a huge tambourine. He looked like a Santa Claus. I felt such a connection with the tambourine. In the first session I felt comfortable and asked my questions for myself during the session. During the session I remembered the past life for the first time. You might ask: “How do you know that it was not an imagination?” The images and the memories which were coming were fully connected to my sensations and feelings. Normally when someone imaging something there are no feelings or sensations, it is just pictures. So, the first I saw myself standing on a dirty road. I was a child around 3 or 5. I was wearing a white sleeveless t-shirt and shorts. My mother was a Gypsy. She left me in a random village just on the road. She did this because some soldiers were collecting kids for their needs, and my mother did not want to give me to them. I was standing in the middle of the road crying and yelling “Don’t go!”. But she left on a wooden wagon. I went into the village and went from one door to another showing that I am hungry and need food. Every house was owned by a white person and no-one gave me anything. At the end of the street was a forest. I went into it and in some time laid down on the ground crying and fell asleep. I woke up at night. A she-wolf was standing near me. She brought some berries. I ate them and fell asleep again. The wolf stayed by my side for the night. In the morning she pushed me to start walking. And our journey started. Sometimes I was walking on my own, other times she was caring me on her back. Finally, we reached an American Indians’s village. The tribal leader accepted me and I started living with the tribal witch. The witch taught me everything and the wolf stayed by my side. Sometimes I hunted with my wolf and the tribe. I grew up a beautiful and strong girl. Once the white people came. They built a fortress not far from our village, and they wanted to get our land. We did not agree to move, so we were in a conflict. One day I was sitting on a field and felt a strong pain in the chest, I realized a white man killed my wolf in the forest. I got so angry and full of hatred. At night, I came into the fortress and killed all the men. I remembered walking out of the fortress. My arms and face were covered with blood, the white women were screaming with sorrow. I came back to the tribe and the lieder accepted me. After a while he offered me the best man to marry. But I chose not to, and I became the next witch in the tribe. The sorrow of the wolf loss was with me till the end.

In that holotropic breathing session I went through all this as well as some other memories shortly. Like I remembered the master of the session as my big white elephant. I was an Indian lady, very rich with a huge property and a house. The elephant was my servant and a friend.

Also, I had a question about my spirit animal. And a face of a cheetah looked at me from the bush. At first, I could not believe because I was so attached to the American Indians and wolves. I was asking: “Is that you who is my spirit animal?” And then I turned into a cheetah, and we ran together in the desert. It was so great.

I got up after a session fully shocked and amazed. We became close friends with that master. His name was Vladislav Kenga. He was the president of Estonian Association of Transpersonal Psychology. He asked me to write him emails, if I feel bad. I was writing him a lot and often. He was doing the sessions in Smolensk, Kaluga and Bryansk, and I was at every session for free as his student. I learned some technics, as mask therapy which I conduct now sometimes. Once Vlad stayed at my flat in the second room for 2 weeks. We talked a lot. He was very supportive. I went through different experiences on the sessions and learned how to maintain them. This type of sessions was transpersonal psychology. Which is not very scientific, but more about your spiritual experience. At that time I started to consult people, so I understood that such sessions do not bring a resolution of inside problems.
